title: What is the probability that a woman will be elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, between January 20, 2025, and January 20, 2031, a woman is inaugurated as the President of the United States. The resolution will be based on the official inauguration records provided by the U.S. National Archives or any other authoritative governmental source. In the event of a dispute regarding the election outcome, the question will resolve based on the decision of the U.S. Supreme Court. If a woman assumes the presidency without an inauguration due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., succession following the incapacitation or death of a sitting president), this will also result in a Yes resolution, provided that she serves as president for at least 24 hours.

title: What is the probability that there will be a new Vice President of the United States by January 1, 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2025, an individual other than the current Vice President as of the date of this question's creation is officially serving as the Vice President of the United States. The change in the Vice President must be confirmed by an official announcement from the U.S. government or a reputable news source. Interim or acting Vice Presidents will count towards resolution only if they are officially carrying out the duties of the Vice President and are not merely temporary placeholders during a brief transition period. In the event of a dispute over the legitimacy of the change in Vice President, the resolution will be based on the recognition by the U.S. Congress. If the current Vice President is re-elected or re-appointed after an election, this will not count as a 'new' Vice President for the purposes of this question.

title: What is the probability that Kamala Harris will become the President of the United States in 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Kamala Harris is officially inaugurated as the President of the United States at any point during the year 2028. The resolution will be based on the official records provided by the U.S. National Archives or any other authoritative governmental source. In the event of a dispute over the inauguration, the resolution will be based on the decision of the U.S. Supreme Court. If Kamala Harris assumes the presidency without an inauguration due to unforeseen circumstances, this will also result in a Yes resolution, provided that she serves as president for at least 24 hours.

title: What is the probability that a new political party will win the majority in the U.S. Senate in 2026?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of 2026, a political party that currently does not hold the majority in the U.S. Senate gains the majority of seats. The resolution will be based on the official records provided by the U.S. Senate or any other authoritative source. In cases where a coalition of parties forms the majority, each party in the coalition will count towards the resolution. In the event of a tied Senate requiring the Vice President to break the tie, the majority party will be considered the party aligned with the Vice President. If the Senate majority is unclear due to disputes or legal challenges, the resolution will default to the official Senate records.

title: What is the probability that a former U.S. President will be elected as a Senator in 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a former President of the United States is elected as a Senator in the U.S. Senate during the year 2024. The resolution will be based on the official election results provided by the U.S. government or any other authoritative source. In the event of a dispute over the election outcome or the eligibility of the former President to run for Senate, the question will resolve based on the decision of the U.S. Supreme Court. If the former President runs but is not elected, the question will resolve as No.

title: What is the probability that a woman will be elected as the Speaker of the House of Representatives in the U.S. Congress by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of 2025, a woman is officially elected as the Speaker of the House of Representatives in the U.S. Congress. The resolution will be based on the official records and announcements provided by the U.S. House of Representatives or any other authoritative governmental source. In the event of a challenge to the election outcome, the resolution will be determined by the U.S. House of Representatives rules and procedures. If a woman assumes the role of Speaker of the House without a formal election due to unforeseen circumstances or the resignation of the incumbent Speaker, this will also result in a Yes resolution, provided that she serves in the position for a substantial period.

title: What is the probability that a new amendment to the U.S. Constitution will be ratified by all states by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of 2030, a new amendment to the U.S. Constitution is ratified by all 50 states. The resolution will be based on the official notifications provided by the U.S. National Archives or any other authoritative governmental source. In cases where a state challenges the ratification process or the validity of the amendment, the resolution will be determined by the decision of the U.S. Supreme Court. If an amendment is ratified but later repealed or nullified, the question will still resolve as Yes if the ratification originally occurred.

title: What is the probability that Andrew Yang will become the Mayor of New York City between 2024 and 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Andrew Yang is elected and serves as the Mayor of New York City at any point between January 1, 2024, and December 31, 2030.
